For extreme case, Sakuno and Miu; Sakuno is still 15-16 yet 162 cms tall, she is still growing for another 2 years and she could simply as tall as 170 which is abnormal for Japan's standard (Japs normally have 158 for girls after growth age); Miu is 17-18 and 146 cms tall, that is also quite out of standard. No one knows what's in the designer's head.\n
Enjoyment achieve perfect score thanks to the fan-service after the second half. For instance, Miu just appeared naked in front of Shingo (WTF!?).

Mashiroiro Symphony: The Color of Lovers is a 1 cour anime. If the anime can be describe in numbers it would be. 
"180"
The anime starts off with the main character Uryuu, Shingo who finds out that his sister Uryuu, Sakuno is lost. Even though she was told to stay still so that her brother can find her more easily over the phone. Her eyes caught an interesting little creature and she decides to follow the little bugger. While making her brother life more difficult her cellphone batteries dies and to top things off rains started pouring all over her! However all is not lost. Luckilyshe finds a tree and hides under it. While waiting for her brother she then encounters a friendly person named Sena, Airi. She aids Sakuno by letting her use her cellphone. Sakuno calls her brother and they have an awkward 3 way conversion over the phone. Shingo eventually figures out a plan and tells the ladies to meet at a park. They finally meet up and Shingo gets to meet Airi, Astonished by her beautiful charm and bust. 


Now at this point for someone who has watch a lot of "harem animes" It would easy to deduct that this guy is a main character! This girl is so kawaii! The final episode must be a kiss scene with each other! Easy Deduction, case solve.


Nope, what this anime deliver is quite a curve ball. A 180 degree turn. Yin Yang.


The anime develops 2 female character very well. Keeping the anime interesting. However the other characters not so much. For female viewers might learn something interesting about men. However as a male viewer it was hurtful to not see the harem ending the way we want. Most harems genre anime usually ends in cliff hangers but this one doesn't so if your interested in watching an anime with a decent build up and an actual ending to a harem genre anime. Then pick this up.

Wow, what to say about this anime, it's just a total mess. It is so obviously based off an eroge game, it kills, it really does... 
Story 2/10
The story is the most unoriginal pile of poo and while didn't sound too awful written, when watching it became overly obvious that it was just so the male protagonist would be placed in the most convenient place possible to form a harem. You could clearly tell the writers had no intention of making the story remotely good, only to make a quick buck from some popular eroge game.
Art 5/10
The art being the high point of the anime,the one and only. It wasn't bad looking and I did find the character designs to be "cute". That's about it... nothing more to really say, it wasn't great and it wasn't awful. Mediocre at best.


Sound 3/10


The voice acting was almost unbearable, they were clearly reading off a script to the point it just seemed like they were yelling out, "Hey, I'm reading my lines." OK,  maybe I over exaggerated, but it was bad.


Character 3/10


The characters had potential to be good, but every time they develop their personality, it immediately changes in the next episode, leading to one of the most bipolar and unoriginal, cookie cutter character cast I've seen in a long while.


Enjoyment 3/10


I found this anime to be total garb and not worth the time of day for any one individual. This anime is better suited as a punishment or a challenge, god only knows how I was able to sit through all of it, because I haven't a clue.


Overall 3/10


This anime was clearly aimed for the fans of the visual novel/eroge game, and I don't see how the ratings are even somewhat decent. Please don't torture yourself, DON'T WATCH! Also, I would like to state that I did little to no back ground research, as in I really don't know if there's an eroge game for it, but watching it, it just seemed obvious.

This is definitely not the best anime in the harem anime genre, but this series does have many elements that make it worth watching and appreciating.
In harem anime, it has become a staple to have a clumsy, awkward and... well... stupid male MC who is, for some reason, likable in some regard which attracts girls to him. When I think of a harem anime MC, I think of Keitaro from Love Hina. This anime however takes a step back from that and gives us... the most generic "nice guy" I have ever seen. This character doesn't have a personality. He is just... nice. He getsverbally taunted or abused... nice. He gets kicked or punched... nice. He gets labelled a pervert due to a typical "misunderstanding"... nice. He is too generic and nice for my liking. My "perfect" harem MC is Keima from The World God Only Knows. This is because Keima has a personality. A very distinct one and not usually common among the genre. A brilliant strategist with no desire to meet girls or have friends. He is cold, ruthless and dedicated to his craft... but he knows his stuff and it creates an interesting dynamic when he is introduced to different character types and elements because he can adapt. This guy in Mashiroiro, is the same no matter who he encounters or what he is doing... nice, nice, nice, nice, nice. The truth is that this anime is like pandora's box... you open it and all the good stuff flies out immediately and all you are left with is hoping that something interesting occurs. "Oh I know, lets have the entire group release a squirrel that we never knew the story of or cared about... lets make it last like 6 minutes." Bah I say. The premise of them being transfer students and the attempt to fit in is dropped nearly entirely about 4 - 5 episodes in. Instead we focus on naming cats, a girl who runs away and cries a lot... while abusing the boy she "loves" verbally and physically... and then we have lots of pointless "nice" talking. Boring. It is enjoyable however. Just don't expect anything to blow you away. No school dance or festival... just worrying about cats.


The fact that the main character cares for everyone around him makes it uninteresting as he is nice to everyone. I could just as easily see him confess his love to the cat... thing... as I could a female character. While he does try and help everyone... a character that just helps people without any reason or backstory as to why he has to help others so much is... again... boring. 


This anime suffers from ADD. For one part, you have the story centered around Sena and the MC. They make a big deal out of this... a lot of episodes... and then out of nowhere she vanished. Literally. She is just... gone. Only seen in a few passing by shots. All that build up for that?! At least have her fade out gracefully. Geez. I understand that because harem anime now have a reputation for being "by the books" that they have decided to try to throw the viewer for a loop... and while I don't mind who he ends up with. It is another case of wasted potential for the sake of a plot twist. Another anime I saw did that. It was called Shuffle!... it had an amazing premise that they flushed down the toilet in order to change pace halfway through to try to be "unique." Garbage. Don't drop a premise that works in an attempt to be even more clever. 



STORY: Very cool premise. Well executed at first... then it dissolves into a boring but enjoyable experience.


ART: I liked it. Smooth. Looked good.


SOUND: Good opening intro and I like the piano throughout.


CHARACTER: MC is a super swell guy. Other characters are interesting and fun.


ENJOYMENT: High. It is boring... and the characters are a bit lacking but it is enjoyable.


REWATCHABILITY: Zero. I will never watch this one again.


OVERALL: Its good. Virtus Signum gives this one a 7/10. Give it a watch.

I enjoyed this anime more than I expected to, I also find myself hating it for certain reasons I can't say due to spoilers, however I can say it has to do with romance situations.
Story
This anime is about two schools who try a merge, some of the students from a mixed gender school go to a all girl academy.  Now you can imaging the reactions from some of the girls at this all girls academy. Anyway Shingo tends to be the mid-way point in a sense, all though not all students like him any better, but he seems to help. He essentially starts gettinginvolved and thus create the plot points of the story, making drama, excitement, and more. I really did enjoy the story overall however like many "harem" anime we all don't like the love choice or however you would like to put it. 


Art

I really liked the art, I liked how the characters looked, all the way to the trees, now I am not so picky on art so long as I can see what everything is and its not drawn like a 4 year old would draw. Anyway this art made everything easier to look at and made the story look a whole lot nicer, especially the cherry blossom scene at one point in the anime. I just found the art made certain scenes a whole lot nicer as it should have.


Sound

Now I was not very fond of the OP, and ED however usually I can at least listening to it a few times however I really don't know why but I couldn't. I found they were okay but not the best. I also didn't really notice the background music popping out to me or even really helping make scenes stand out more. I realize that maybe I was not paying attention enough but there was two times it did stand out so I am going to assume it was just the music not being good enough for me. If that makes any sense. 


Character

Now the main characters all got some screen time, we found out most situations, however there is one character that was my favorite she was a key corner stone to the story however she did not really get a "situations" it was more of a "this is why I said this" kind of thing, and I was also disappointed because of another issue with this same character, and this is me just expressing my opinion due to my favorite character being rejected.

Anyway overall the character development was okay, all them got screen time, and there was no real cliff hanging character development at the end, unless you count being curious about a certain characters feelings when it all ends.


Enjoyment

As I stated many times in this review, I am pretty upset about a certain character, however that does not change the fact I enjoyed the anime. I do wish the ending was a little different, well I wish things were different from around episode 8, but I still think it is worth a watch. 


Overall

I think if you like romance anime you should watch it, if you like animals go and watch it, if you like anime maybe go and watch it. I really think it is one of the better "harem anime" so please give it a try.


P.s If I am getting it wrong and it is in fact not a harem genre then please excuse me. However I believe you all get my point.

Allow me to preface this by saying that the only thing barring this from a better review from me was its depressing brevity. I felt like this could have easily been at least a 25 episode show, and it ended all too soon. I ranked the story as a 7 for this reason (given more time and character development, it would have been worth a possible 10). 
I began watching this expecting another fun, rom-com harem. Oh, and the end of the first episode made me thing that perhaps some forbidden romance with his sister was brewing as well. Thankfully, my expectations were rather wrongon all accounts. 


For starters, the main character was NOT a douche-bag. (Perhaps oblivious at times, but isn't that a requirement for a male high school character in an anime?) In fact, he was a rather admirable, kind hearted guy with a soft spot for animals and a penchant for wanting to help people. 


As for the harem aspect, yes, it seems that all the main female characters were in love with the male protagonist. However, the way they dealt with it seemed surprisingly good to me. The story spent more time developing the ways the girls dealt with their unrequited feelings, and I felt like I watched each of them mature a little over the course of those twelve episodes. My two favorite girls dealt with their feelings differently--one with brave stoicism, the other by shedding many tears before realizing how to move on. But it seemed great, and was a real tear-jerker in parts. Although the girl I was rooting for "lost," I still like the way the show ended and the girl the MC ended up with. I'll probably watch it again in a couple of months.

What ensues is the repetitive, redundant marching out of potential partner candidates for the main character. Well, that's pretty much what I would expect out of this genre, so no harm. However, the pacing of the story proceeds to suckthe viewer in for a good 6 episodes thinking that the OTP (one true pair) is with a tsundere girl who initially resists the idea of having boys in her school. She eventually warms up to the idea and develops feelings for the main, only to be completely left out of the 2nd half of the script until for virtually the last episode. The proceeding next five episode focuses on a girl who has trouble dealing with her growing feelings for the boy and even goes towards great lengths to even have him notice her. In the end, the producers produce a big eff you plot twist as if to say that the first 10 episodes you just saw don't even matter. If they were serious about putting forth any sort of entertainment value into resolving the last plot twist, there weren't have been as many female characters, because given the length of the series and the number of charcters the show had, most of the characters were about as interesting as a piece of cheese. The roles that were actually focused on were written out for who knows what reason? (marketing eroge???) and the end result is that a very pissed off viewer who feels as if he's just wasted 5 hours watching this.

Mashiroiro Symphony: The Color of Lovers
NEVER Judge a book by its cover..........On the outside Mashiroiro Symphony reminds me more of a Game/Visual Novel adaptation rather than a Manga. Characters who seem after the first few episodes to lack any real depth or development and a series that will rely on Fan-Service or Ecchi moments to pull them through this 12 Episode series...............How wrong i was.
Story: 7
The Story is a little different with the aspect of the main character, Uryuu Shingo & others having merged schools. His school Kagamidai Private Academy is now being being merged with the "Elite" Yuihime Girls' Private Academy. This creates obvioustension with school mates sticking to their own groups and the boys in the merger to be somewhat alienated by a certain section of the Yuihime School thinking they shouldn't be allowed to be there as it was an all "Girls Only" School.


For me this was the "Initial" which i felt was rather unique for a School/Romance series. After this the story developed a Club story which is the driving force for the later part of the series.


Overall i enjoyed the story, But did find it lacking a little, After the unique aspect to start with it just became "Another" Club orientated series, It just didn't really have another idea to go onto and solely relied on the Character development to get them through.


Art: 8


As i hinted before this felt like more of a "Game" adaption, The characters have nice perhaps over the top styling,  But it works + Also the background art and everything else is superb, Aired 2011, But far better than some i'm seeing today in 2013.


Sound: 7


All the female voices were really nice, my slight criticism would be some felt a bit too similar but you're bound to get this slight problem in many "Harem" type series. My personal favorite was Miu Amaha (Rikimaru Noriko) who's voice was perfect.


Character: 9 


From my opening paragraph i mentioned that i felt this series was more similar to a Visual Novel/Game, What i mean by that the first few episodes just made me feel like the characters would be rather simplistic and really have no depth or personality to them, How wrong i was. The more the series went on they gave enough information for the people in the Harem to understand them more and you really do become attached to certain characters even if the outset you didn't think you would. 


The Romantic "Harem" part was really done nicely and is a staple for any Romantic show, The story did run dry at points and many episode near the end Mashiroiro Symphony simply relied on the characters to help them get through the episodes, I for one felt this part of the show was so strong and is refreshing to see development done this well in a series i perhaps thought wouldn't have this depth.


Enjoyment / Enjoyment


Mashiroiro Symphony to me is a nice surprise, Something i felt that would another really average Romance series that had no real development or plot turned out to be a big surprise and a series i thoroughly enjoyed.


The series even wrapped up the romantic aspect and even gave additional "Bonus" Episodes to give the twist of how the other arcs could of finished which i felt was a nice touch


So overall, A very nice and well rounded Harem/Romantic series that i would highly recommend, The score is tough because 7 felt a tad too low yet 8 too high. So in the end i went for 8.

Shingo Uryuu: A very very basic male character which you can get jealous off easily.


Sakuna Uryuu: She TOO plain and should not be counted as a main character!


Angelina Nanatsu Sewell: A maid who is always happy and cheerful but a bit too into her job.


Airi Sena: A very bossy girl with a strange background.


Sana Inui: Shana I..mean Sana is a tsundere redhead which reminds me of Shana from Shakugan No Shana.


Miu Amaha: A sweet and kind girl. She is a year older than all the other main characters, She also has a pet named Pannya.


Enjoyment: Didn't enjoy it a first but it was great and surprising in the end but I felt wanting more.


Overall: Good towards the end but because of that it is not too good.


Recommended age to watch: 13+

I love harem animes but I finish a lot so I found this show and I am currently in episode 6 since I rewatch this show and I thought to myself this is the blandest show. the main character makes me want to punch him in the face the sister is boring and in episode 6 I believe (spoiler) the maid character was living with the main character for like at least 1 or half an episode and the principal told her to leave since they needed help in the school and I think it's because the creators just thought that if there was anotherperson in the main character's house then it wouldn't balance the harem or something. overall I will give it a bad score for the boringness but if you want to kill time then I recommend it

I truly never take the time to write a review, but this time I felt it was necessary. This anime had great potential but ended being a painful experience.
The anime starts with decent quality, MC is a typical harem guy who can't do anything but smile and be nice. That's the MC from the start to the end, with no flaws and no development to be done through the story.
All the girls start the same, being archetypes of a harem anime too, but at least they all end having some kind of development, specially two of them, only one girl remained being a common shyanime doll until the last episode.\n\n
And I said watching this becomes a painful experience because the anime builds up the story for the other girls, trying to make you feel something for them, and when you finally start caring, the show makes an anti-climatic pairing of the MC with the only girl with no backstory, and if that wasn't enough they show us with great detail the suffering of the other girls.\n\n
Truly this is not the worst anime that I have ever seen, but I rate this so low because of the annoyance it made me feel, a similar thing that happened with baka to test ending.

I was pretty excited for this anime since I've played the PC version.
Found that this anime was not too bad, character design wise was awesome and beautiful. However on the romance side, I didn't really like how it turned out since it wasn't what I expected it would be. I expected it to be more romantic and a bit of humor I guess. The ending was the one that was a little too boring.
But the characters were the one that kept me going since they were well designed and makes the viewers fall in love with each one of them. 
Overall, if you are oneof those who love to watch anime's with cute and beautiful girls, this anime is just for you.
